title: "We want a hard MMR reset, we don't care about the matches being unbalanced for a while"

How? He's from EUNE. There's no normal draft anymore. {{item:3070}}  {{item:3070}}  {{item:3070}}

I don't think most people understand what happened.

Flex Queue is completely fresh as far as data is concerned. EVERYBODY starts with the same MMR, because nobody ever played this queue.

It's going to be a whole different thing when solo/duo queue will be turned on, because it inherited Dynamic Queue's MMR.

It was either that or DQ-boosted tools getting Gold in two queues at once for free.
Im not sure what people thought hard mmr reset meant...
It would be nice to reset the damage done by DQ. As it stands, there will be bronze players in gold/silver for the next couple years at least.

Not really.
They won't be able to carry their placements, and if they drop some from there, they will have difficulties climbing anyhow.

What? A hard mmr reset will undo the damage done by DQ. Any difficulty in climbing will solely be due to the individual player's skill or lack thereof. Of course, there will be a period where things are very chaotic while mmrs normalize, but after a month or two (maybe three) everything will be back to the way it was in season 5.

So instead of letting things normalize over a few months naturally, let's fuck everything up even harder? (It won't take years as claimed)

People who had been boosted won't be able to climb or maintain their current rank. It's better to let them fall nautrally than to force everyone to deal with widely varied skills in their matches for several months.

Read what I have outlined for you and start accepting the basic fact of how this system works. If an mmr reset does not occur for solo Q, bronze trash will be in gold/silver for at least another year.

They won't be climbing, only falling, or sitting on rank after placements.

So you would rather mess everything up for EVERYONE instead of the (relatively) low number of games those boosted players will be on as they fall?

>sitting on rank after placements

Exactly, and reaping the benefits of the end of season rewards and being given the right to call themselves "good players". If this is allowed to happen, then competitive integrity will continue to decline until mmr self-corrects in a couple years.

I'd rather let them sit on a free skin and drop a full tier off placements for a year or two than destroy people's ability to have decent games while MMR fixes itself out over half a season.

If someone is boosted just to gold, they're likely sitting at G4/5. Placements in S7 will plop them into silver.
Or, maybe they are lucky, got boosted to high gold or plat, and drop down to low Gold in placements, then sit on their rank. Guess what this means? They aren't going to be in games where they don't belong after that. Then next season, they drop more.

But they get a free skin for it?
Who
Fucking
Cares
?

It's not the skin. Honestly, victorious skins feel more and more half-assed every year, with this one being pretty much stupid. It's the idea that even a singular player can abuse the system to get a rank higher than he/she deserves. That is literally the exact reason why Riot is doing away with DQ in the first place.
years? thats a little excessive.
Most people that said it were joking. Like "Yeah we should totally just get a hard reset and put bronze and challenger in bronze". No one wanted that obviously.

Well, to be fair I wanted everyone bronze-plat to be hard reset, then diamond+ to be put around platinum. So they took my idea a little too far, but this way we get to see why exactly challenger players are challenger. 
(Keep in mind almost no lower tiers get to play with challengers, and some peoples days have easily been made as a result.)

You said that, but I've seen just as many Challenger plays complaining about being placed with bronze, and then being placed IN bronze, so that isn't necessarily true. The only reason "less" people would is because there are only 200 challenger spots, and probably 20 of those are smurfs.

This totally sucks because every game is just one team getting annihilated... The teams are almost never even in MMR. If it was a wide range but kept the teams the same MMR then fine. And i personally dont mind play against high plat mid laners, but every game is feast or famine. And the famine games are awful. Super anti fun for your entire team to feed and you just wait for the 20 min mark in hopes that youre teammates will surrender because the rest of your team is bronze and silver and the D5 Diana who's 15/0 is just roflstomping everyone. My friend just did his promos and because the last 7 games were tilted in the enemies favor he got placed in bronze 4 lol. I really hope this is very temperary{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
lol

This is so dumb I can't even play enjoyable games anymore.
I just want to play with people at my skill level T_T

So do low elo players, but that doesn't stop hundreds of heavily smurf effected games for the last 3 seasons?

Its only been like a few days.
True story there

Just played a normal game. I'm gold 4 and I got paired with 3 plats and a level 27. 

The level 27 fed to hell because obviously newer player. But how he fuck did we get this one? Jesus. 

The plats also played like shit. I get that its a normal game but really? The fun goes to shit when it's 4v5.

LOL so true. The hard reset has been a straight up clusterfuck. On my alt acct had everything from Diamond 3 to bronze 5 with a huge mix & match in the team. Had some straight up uncarryable teammates who would go straight AP Aatrox and auto feed, those who chase all the way to the enemy fountain and actually die to fountain etc. Went 5-5 with nothing less than an A rated performance and got put into bronze 3.

So yeah, I just finished my 10 placements in FLEX after finishing as silver 3 in season 6 and got placed in bronze 4.  Every placement game had a ridiculously unbalanced mmr similar to 1 diamond, 2 plats, 1 gold, 1 silver on the enemy team; with maybe 1 plat on my team if I got lucky, 2 gold, 2 silver, and a bronze.  I don't mind playing against higher tiers because I've been holding my own rather well, what's irritating is I lose games that are heavily unbalanced and then get punished for it.  I've been placed in bronze the last 3 seasons and worked my way out, so when will I get placed AT LEAST back into silver??
You should get placed in Bronze if you finished Silver. Why should you get placed right back where you finished the season before?
if the reset went as planned, you'd barely change in MMR at all in silver/bronze so unless you go 0/10 in placements as someone who was Silver 3 or higher youd stay in silver.
who is we, who wanted this?

Some challenger guy went 10-0 in placements and got placed BRONZE V.

So... I guess something is indeed broken.
